body: The tests corresponding to the move cell keyboard shortcuts need to be removed too.

gah, sorry, git confusion, pushed directly to master. Anyway, I did remove the test in 5b49edb44f9fe993bc6ed16f761717627486e135, so I'll keep an eye on Travis, and if it passes, everything's OK, right?
Yup
[Tests OK](https://travis-ci.org/ipython/ipython/builds/50269042)
Thanks @rossant !

@rossant I would like to get the "go to left" /" go to right key" edit shortcuts back in IPython3. I would like to bind them to other than home and end which does not appear on my laptop.  Is there anywhere that I can find the right commands to put them in the custom.js file?

Note the following is cleaner as you don't define a anonymous function. 

``` javascript
> IPython.keyboard_manager.command_shortcuts.add_shortcut('Shift-k','ipython.move-selected-cell-up')
< undefined

>IPython.keyboard_manager.command_shortcuts.add_shortcut('Shift-j','ipython.move-selected-cell-down')
< undefined
```

I have figured out how to get this to work in jupyter with the following commands but can it be added to the config file in some place so all notebooks are loaded with this? I can't seem to figure out the location to do this and adding as an extension ddin't work?

```
Jupyter.keyboard_manager.command_shortcuts.add_shortcut('Ctrl-k','jupyter-notebook:move-cell-up')
Jupyter.keyboard_manager.command_shortcuts.add_shortcut('Ctrl-j','jupyter-notebook:move-cell-down')
```

There wasn't a custom.js file or even a custom folder so I created one and added the above but it doesn't seem to be loading this in for any new notebooks. Anyway to check if it is loading the custom.js file?
Os X ? That would be in `~/Library/Jupyter/custom`. You can also run `jupyter --data-dir` to know where these files should be.

Yes Os X. The data directory is shows as `~/Library/Jupyter/` as you have stated but when I move `custom/custom.js` in there still nothing happens when I start up a new notebook. The keybindings do not work. Is there a way to check if it is reading in the function maybe just not initializing on startup?

> That would be in ~/Library/Jupyter/custom

No, looking at the code, custom lives in the config dir (i.e. `~/.jupyter`) not the data dir.

> No, looking at the code, custom lives in the config dir (i.e. ~/.jupyter) not the data dir.

My bad, it's symlinked on my system.  so yes, it should be in `~/.jupyter/custom/custom.js`.

Can you tell us what's in  your JS console of your browser ? (try to force reload the page a few times)

Link to a sceenshot below so it seems to see the custom.js file but must not be loading properly.

And the error is this so can't seem to find command_shortcuts on load:

`TypeError: Cannot read property 'command_shortcuts' of undefined(…)Module.check @ require.js:900
main.min.js:24082 Default extension for cell metadata editing loaded.`

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/oeepfgtzyhr8695/Screenshot%202016-03-11%2010.53.24.png?dl=0]

I was trying this custom js too, I have the same error (more or less):

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'command_shortcuts' of undefined(…)check @ require.js?v=6da8be3…:900
default.js:48Default extension for cell metadata editing loaded.
```

I have an up to date `jupyter[notebook]`, running on OSX 10.11.
Might be worth re-opening https://github.com/jupyter/notebook/issues/21 so that we can discuss this in the right organization given that it's still an issue that comes up.

Did anyone manage to put together a working implementation of a custom.js file to re-instate the keyboard shortcut for moving cells up and down?

Also while trying to figure it out, and running out time, I found the console warning "Notebook.move_cell_down is deprecated as of v4.1 and will be removed in v5.0"
Maybe this is referencing a different function that has been updated but I thought I'd mention it anyway.

Yes, I miss this feature horribly.  Losing the shortcuts pushes editing notebooks past the inconvenience barrier to the state where I really need to convert the notebooks to something else to edit them.

There are some bugs in libraries we ship with recent versions of notebook that prevent custom shortcuts  to work correctly (Singletons end up not being singletons). We're trying to figure that out, but we are between a rock and a hard place as fixing this break other things.
@Carreau , any update on this?
I'm curious about this as well.
